page.title: 01WEST KIRBY / HOYLAKE
page.content:
This area has seen great changes in lifestyles over the past 100 years. The small{fishing}communities have been affected by the silting up of the coast. All that remains of the fishing industry today is small scale 'cockling' and about 20 boats engaged in part time, seasonal fishing. Much of the surrounding farm land has been built over.
The construction of the railway from {Liverpool}stimulated the building of large Victorian residences, many of which are now converted to flats, nursing homes and private schools. The{seaside holiday}trade of the first half of the 20th. century has now declined, and today is based mainly on day excursions.
